Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Aortic Valve Replacement on Myocardial Function

Trial_Design.evidence: 100 patients enrolled in a clinical trial

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included patients with aortic stenosis undergoing AVR.

Intervention.evidence: 97 patients underwent AVR for aortic stenosis.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to characterize the effect of intraoperative events on left ventricular (LV) function using echocardiographic measures of myocardial deformation and to evaluate right ventricular (RV) function.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Echocardiographic images were analyzed for global longitudinal myocardial strain and strain rate.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 100 patients enrolled in a clinical trial

Number_Analysed.evidence: Echocardiographic images were acceptable for analysis in 72 patients for LV strain, 67 for LV strain rate, and 54 for RV strain and strain rate.

Result_Outcome.evidence: LV strain did not change significantly [difference: 0.7 (97.6% CI: 0.2, 1.5)%; P = 0.07], while LV systolic strain rate improved [−0.3 (−0.4, −0.2) sec−1; P < 0.001]. RV systolic strain worsened [difference: 4.6 (3.1, 6.0)%; P < 0.001], with no change in RV systolic strain rate [0.0 (97.6% CI: −0.1, 0.1); P = 0.83].
